info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 10:25PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern McDonough and southeastern Hancock Counties through 1045 PM CDT... At 1025 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Colmar, or 15 miles southeast of Carthage, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern McDonough and southeastern Hancock Counties, including the following locations... Hancock County Fairgrounds, Doddsville and Plymouth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
